Sketching Quartics

Like other polynomials we can also sketch quartic functions. A quartic is a polynomial with degree \(4\). The general form of a quartic is \(P(x) = ax^4 + bx^3 +cx^2 +dx+e\). This is the expanded form of the quartic. We may also wish to find the fully factorised form. For example \[ y = x^4 -4x^3-x^2+16x-12 \: \mbox{(expanded)} \qquad \: y = (x+2)(x-1)(x-3) \mbox{ (factorised)}. \]
